Detailed Description

Cipl is the public interface to the Cidana Player Control Interface.

Author:
Cidana, Inc.
Version:
2.0

It requires the CiplJni.dll to implement the JNI interface and the CiplMgr.dll for the Simplified Rev2 Interface.

Member Function Documentation

CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.closeManager ( )

Closes the manager instance.

This deallocates run-time data resources for the Player instance.

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.convertReturnToError ( String[]  returnArray)

Used to check if the return string array from execute is an error.

Returns a CiplError value.

Parameters:
returnArrayis the return string array from execute()
Returns:
CiplError representing the return value in ret[0].
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.createManager ( )

Creates the Manager instance and allocates data resources.

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager is already created.
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.createSession ( String  session,
int  flags 
)

Creates a session.

A session must be created for playback. Each session consists of a audio/video playback stream, so for 2 picture-in-picture windows, 2 sessions must be created.

An arbitrary number of sessions may be created, limited only to system resources.

Parameters:
sessionis the name of the session. May be null.
flagsare the option flags (should be 0).
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.destroyManager ( )

Destroys the manager instance and deallocates any data resources and any additional dlls loaded.

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.destroySession ( String  session)

Destroys a session.

Parameters:
sessionis the name of the session. May be null.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
void com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.eventCallback ( String[]  eventArray) [virtual]

Used as default callback for events in Cipl class.

eventCallback is called by the player manager whenever an event is generated asynchronous to one of the function calls. For example, device change, playlist change, uop change.

Parameters:
eventArrayA string array of 3 strings.
eventArray[0] is Session name which generates event (may be null or empty)
eventArray[1] Event name string blob: (event_name>)''(Param1)''(Param2). It is recommended to ignore Param1 and Param2. If the event is not user servicable, it will be of form 0xhhhhhhhh (a hex value).
eventArray[2] Event data string blob This is implementation dependent.

Implements com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.

String [] com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.execute ( String  session,
String  command 
)

Executes a command in for a particular session.

This is the principal method of controlling playback.

Parameters:
sessionis the session name, may be null.
commandis the command to execute, e.g. "play".
Returns:
String array of three strings
returnArray[0] Error condition (if not empty). This will be one of the accepted CiplError names.
returnArray[1] If successful return data is a string blob here. May be empty or "".
returnArray[2] unused. returns exactly ""
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.freeLibrary ( )

Frees the PlayerControl Library (CiplMgr.dll).

This releases any code resources.

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if library hasn't been loaded.
String com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.getMgrEnv ( String  name)

Gets the manager environment variable.

Parameters:
nameis the name of the environment variable.
Returns:
null on error (or name not found)
Value of the environment variable sName.

Parameters:

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.openManager ( int  flags,
char  escape 
)

Opens the manager instance.

This allocates run-time data resources for the Player instance.

Parameters:
flagsshould be 0.
escapeis the escape character used to communicate string blobs safely across the JNI interface. It can be 0, but is recommended to be some control character such as 0x1a.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
CI_EOUTOFMEMORY if no memory resources available.
static void com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.printBlob ( String  blob) [static]

A shorthand method to print a string blob (example of blob extraction).

This version does the printing without an escape character and is not recommended.

Parameters:
blobis the string blob to print, e.g. asReturn[1].
static void com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.printBlob ( String  blob,
char  escape 
) [static]

A shorthand method to print a string blob with escape (example of blob extraction).

This requires the same escape character passed into openManager().

Parameters:
blobis the string blob to print, e.g. asReturn[1].
escapeis the escape character passed in openManager().
CiplError com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.setEventCallback ( CiplCallback  ciplCallback)

Sets a single event callback.

Parameters:
ciplCallbackis an instance of the ciplcallback interface. Inherit from this interface for any object to receive event callbacks. If set to null, it installs the default callback in the Cipl class which simply prints out the event information.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.

Parameters:

datais the string to set the variable to.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.

Object  windowPointer 
)

Sets the window for the session from external pointer.

Parameters:
sessionis the session name. Must be created
windowPointeris a window "pointer" obtained from the Java framework.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been created.
void com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.subtitleCallback ( int[]  buffer,
int  width,
int  height,
int  type,
boolean  display 
) [virtual]

Raw subtitle data callback function form player control.

subtitleCallback must be implemented from this interface to handle raw subtitle data callback from Player Control Manager. This interface will not invoked by default, you can use "set subtitleoutput" to set subtitle output on/off and raw data format.

Parameters:
bufferThe raw data in int buffer.
width Width of subtitle.
height Height of subtitle.
type Format of raw subtitle data, 0 for YUV420 1 for ARGB8888
display Display or not, true for display this frame, false for erase last display.

Implements com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.

void com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.videoFrameCallback ( String  type,
long[]  nativeBuffer,
int  width,
int  height,
int[]  stride 
) [virtual]

Raw video frame buffer callback function from player control.

videoFrameCallback must be implemented from this interface to handle raw video frame buffer callback from Player Control Manager. This interface will not invoked by default, you can use "set videoframeoutput" to set video frame output on/off.

Parameters:
typeFormat of the video frame
nativeBuffer An int array contains the pointer(s) to the native buffer of the raw video frame. The count of the pointer(s) (i.e. array size) depends on the format of the raw video frame
width Width of video frame. (Count in pixel)
height Height of video frame. (Count in pixel)
stride Length of row in a video frame. (Count in byte) Due to the performance impact and requirement of the alignment of memory address, the actual space allocated for each row of a video frame may larger than [video frame width]*[bytes per pixel]

Implements com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.
